-MI-aW1O71QTbdwclc50nw.text: I've been here SO many time and have always gotten great service and never have had less than amazing food!  Other than the pho (which is honestly the best I've had personally as of yet) I definitely recommend starting off with the stuffed chicken wings and/or egg rolls and getting the Royal fried rice with the pineapple. I've heard good things about other items they have and have tried other things since I mooch off my friends every once in a while, but other than a nice hot steaming 'just right' bowl of combination pho with extra noodles those are my personal go-tos.

fVBXbmXUWf_UYlI_wRB3XQ.text: First of all I should explain that I'm no Pho expert, but I *have* had this dish at many places, especially in Greensboro, where I live. I've even made a pretty good Pho at home. Expert? Nah. Enthusiast? YES! I also don't feel it's completely fair to review a restaurant after going only once. But, as I don't frequent Charlotte all that often, here it goes... I found "Pho Real" (clever name) to have a very pleasant atmosphere, dark-ish with neon. The waitstaff gets an A+... very attentive and very helpful. I told the waiter that I loved Pho but wanted to try something slightly different. He suggested Hu Tieu (chicken soup, very similar to Pho). It was served quickly and was presented with an abundance of jalapeno, a whole garden-full of basil, mung bean sprouts, plenty of noodles and lime wedges. Waiter said it was their most popular dish. Unfortunately, I have a couple of slightly negative comments: Broth was chicken, as advertised, but a bit weak and lacking the explosive flavor one gets with a good Vietnamese noodle soup dish... even something so potentially bland as chicken (the menu claimed it was a chicken/pork/seafood-based stock -- I would've expected a little more "strength" from a stock with all three of those components). The Hu Tieu also had "seafood" *in* it (also as advertised) but that consisted a single shrimp and a couple of that fake crab glop that cheapens any dish. The Pho restaurants I've been to have real shrimp, calamari, etc. No fake stuff. This restaurant has a LOT of dishes on it's menu, so I'm sure there are some delightful stand-outs. However, it IS a Pho restaurant, so I hope THAT dish is up to par. I have to admit, if my first experience at Vietnamese cuisine had been this place, I may not have become a fan of this type of food. Fortunately, I *AM!!!*. When arriving you are faced with a bit of a 2-story climb (even though I'm an out-of-shape old guy, it looked worse than it really was). But, if you've got some elderly friends/family with you, you should know that there is an elevator conveniently located around back of said stairs. Oh, and by the way, I ordered a Bloody Mary here, and it was HORRIFIC. Sorry, it just was. Too much pickle brine, I believe. You CAN put pickle brine in a Bloody Mary, but definitely NOT that much. A question of personal taste? Yes. Too much brine for anyone on the face of the planet? Absolutely! Bleech!!! And I *LOVE* pickles!!! I should say something good about this place (beside the pleasant ambiance and excellent waitstaff): I truly think this is an GREAT place to bring a group that wants to experience Vietnamese cuisine but might have the varied tastes that comes with a number of people, i.e.: its got quite a lot to choose from on the menu! And... I'll bet quite a few thing are quite flavorful... I just didn't get the chance to try them all! I'm giving this place 2 stars as Yelp says 2 stars = "Meh. I've experienced better." That "Meh" comment is pretty much spot on. This is definitely NOT a "bad" place... not by a long shot... it's just that I've had substantially "better". And just in Greensboro. Yikes!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Real Vietnamese Restaurant and Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hu Tieu chicken noodle dish at Pho Real (Charlotte, NC)

aacdA9NjqpjfL2BPOCKL2Q.text: Went for dinner and thought it was great. I had  a wide noodle dish with pho real sauce and veggies as my entree and veggie rolls for my appetizer. My friend had the fried rice with chicken and kept saying how delicious it was. Our server was plesant. Will definitely be returning.

4gj-k4pHoL9aaHvGhoZp2w.text: This place isn't Saigon Bay.  The Pho isn't nearly as flavorful as at Saigon Bay.  I did an experiment where I went to Saigon Bay, then Pho Real, and then back to Saigon Bay - each time accompanied by my brother.  He had been a long time attendee of Pho Real and he preferred Saigon Bay.  The difference is real.  The prices here are lower than Saigon Bay but the portions are smaller and the flavor isn't to my liking.  Both have competent waitstaff and plenty of parking.  I usually don't write a review and name drop a competing restaurant but these two are so close together.  I can't think of  a single reason I would ever go to Pho Real.  Even if Saigon Bay closed down I would search somewhere else for that level of flavor and enjoyment.

sU0Mfxao8gX2v0FrD3smDQ.text: Came in because of the rave reviews but was met with terrible service. The greeter let after we came in and busted a table before directing us to the bar too place our to go order. Then the bartender didn't acknowledge us when we came to the bar. I understand she was making drinks but an "I'll be with you in a moment" would have been nice.   Then she directed us to a sign to place order online and receive 10% off but mentioned she hadn't noticed the 10% coming off.  FALSE ADVERTISEMENT! I asked to speak to the manager on duty about the False advertising and she said both were out then when questioned further she said she was the night manager. I wasn't trying to take advantage I was merely responding to the advertisement. Sad thing is I tip a standard $20 during the holidays but since she is the "undercover" manager she won't miss it.

Tv62BYtJ4MX_DmMgE4Fpxg.text: It's a pho restaurant but the pho's broth taste so dull lol. Very good and friendly customer service though.

Qi40J6OAAXqlS9iRIgv6BA.text: Great food awesome service and so authentic I know I'll be back for more than Pho. The lemonade was truly freshly squeezed matter of fact it was made in front of us.

Lnd4-En8kW1FVsEws3_UfA.text: If you are a novice pho eater this place is fine, but if you know what quality is, go somewhere else.  Unfortunately at Pho Real they don't have real pho.  I would have to say that the quality was that of a fast food restaurant.  I was worried about that when I went in and it was very nice and hip!  That's usually a tell-tale sign that it's more style than substance.  The broth was pretty weak, and that's what it comes down to.  Meat was fine, noodles were ok, portion size was a so so.  The ambiance and service were great!  We also ordered spring roles.  Very bland.

nYw9nUYXG_7rcPfEh5nA5Q.text: When I write a review. I always try it atleast 3times. First times was not a great experience nor was the other two times. Service was below average. If your running a restaurant you should always tell people if you've ran out of stuff like vegetables ahead of times, instead of waiting till you bring out someone's meal. Waiting for forks and spoon after 10min after your food is not great either. I've ate at many other pho places. And this place is the worst at cutting corner(trust me I know I grew up on pho). All in all, there are a lot more thing that I can complain about but I'll keep it to a minimum. This place is for beginner of Vietnamese cuisine. Wouldn't recommend for any of my friends. It's a shame I have to give it even a star.  #teamfatazz

zl1zWIHaYBiDn6vCjM3oig.text: Can not wait for another layover in Charlotte to try more things out. Had the shrimp spring rolls and the broken rice with shrimp, beef, and porkchop, which could drive you crazy with the aroma alone. The pho looked like the most popular dish by far

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Real Vietnamese Restaurant and Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

azoeUDL59o_176cBVJw4RA.text: Bun bo hue from here is always delicious.  Years ago, I use to hate this place.  To this day, the hate still sticks around.  The pho and service here use to be awful.  I would make the extra ten minute drive to the pho places in the ghetto just for better service and better pho.  Lately, I've given them another chance.  Their service has been more than excellent.  I've been there three times within the past month since I've decided to give them another chance.  2/3 times, I ordered food that was delicious (both bun bo hue).  3/3 times the service was quick, polite, and attentive to the table's needs.  They've come a long way with service and food quality from when I quit eating there four years ago.  The restaurant itself is clean and the seating is very spacious.  They have a full service bar and it's quiet there for the most part.  If you asked me four years ago to recommend a pho place, I would immediately tell people to go to Central Avenue or I'd offer to make it.  Now, if you're looking for a good pho place in the university area, I would recommend pho real.  Whatever you guys did to turn your food and restaurant around, awesome!  Keep doing it!

q4P1NmHAEnhEZJx1NgbnNw.text: A bit better than what you might expect in a mall. Fresh ingredients, but lacking depth and complexity in the pho broth. Beautiful fresh Thai basil, very nice meat in the pho, but without good broth pho falls flat. Very heavy cinnamon flavor.

au01jkWRSLsU2roWBcNNjg.text: Loveee their food. The pho is delicious with the chili sauce. But I never been disappointed with anything on the menus

dLGvdh1q3y6h8UVWiM_KLA.text: Went here with my girlfriend for a casual lunch. Great food, great price. Will definitely come bak if I am in the area.

wRZtt-pqeXlrESUltWlwRg.text: If you like pho, this is a great spot! I lived in Raleigh where there are over a dozen pho places. This one equals at the very least :-)

Pp9dSyz2MpHxhe-Z5gC-6A.text: I came here with my boyfriend after a day at Carowinds and was pleasantly surprised by how good this place was. Usually I pick the pho restaurants we go to but he suggested this one, and I would most definitely come here again. It's located in a nice little shopping complex on the second story.   The restaurant itself has quite a few tables but it was pretty full because Saturday night. However, we were seated quickly and given menus. You can get pho in 4 different sizes, which I LOVED. There's a big bowl, a just right bowl, a small bowl, and a bowl for kids (I assumed). Extra points for that. Price points are pretty reasonable for the sizes as well. I ordered a small bowl of pho (their most popular combo of meats) and my boyfriend got the biggest pho with flank and rare eyeround with no onions and cilantro. I was sick earlier during the day and I was able to keep my food down, which was nice.  The broth was very light and clear which means that they boiled it for a long time. It was really flavorful and I slurped up pretty much every single drop. I also liked that they had lime wedges and not lemon ones (and they were very generous with their lime, bean sprouts and basil). Overall, very delicious. Service was also very good! Water glasses were constantly checked and everyone seemed very nice.  Complaints: as my boyfriend was signing the check, I saw a sizable black bug on the ground. And the sanitation score was only 90. I mean, being Asian, I'm not tooooo picky about that... but the bug was honestly pretty gross. Yep.

RBMYmjWJt8Fqedzknsva9w.text: Its not bad pho, its just not great pho.  When I wrote my first review I was a rookie and didn't have anything to compare it too.  Now that my pho palate has some notches in its belt I can say that this isn't the real deal.  Maybe I was here on an off day, but the broth just didn't have that depth and complexity as compared to Ben Thanh or Vietnam Grille.  Thats really about the extent of my review.  The ambiance is nice and I'd say if you are in the area its worth visiting, but other than that, there are other places worth the journey.

2V4F_upNQilb-e84ssawfw.text: Great pho, great service, quick delivery of food. The broth was quite tasty, especially when I added lime, basil, and jalapenos to my liking. My only critique is that the veggies should be cut smaller. It's impossible to cut through an entire head of bok choy with a spoon.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Real Vietnamese Restaurant and Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cauliflower &#34;rice&#34;

KWe85_Eg6yU-1AVhyCz3hA.text: Not only was everything delicious (iced tea, fresh spring rolls, pho), but the chef made my dish individually to avoid any gluten the recipe usually has (the lemongrass tofu was made without soy sauce and was still out of this world!). the service was perfect. I used to live in this area of Charlotte and am happy to have found amazing, accessible Vietnamese where once there was none.

D21rcICWroH7NmbZbcSxkQ.text: This is my favorite Pho restaurant in Charlotte.  Its a step up fro most I have been to- really well decorated, and clean!  The food is excellent, and they have a very robust menu- they offer several other asian soup dishes other than Pho, as well as rice, eggrolls, etc.  Recently, they have added healthier options, so I usually order Pho with "Zoodles" (Zucchini Noodles). Highly recommend you request a side of their chili-oil, it adds the perfect touch to their soups.

Xhr2sBBLVncL1_dEgtPXEA.text: I love the atmosphere and food is amazing. The servers are great. The food reminds of when I went to Tokyo fresh and fast.

seJbkprIg8dVP0m-yEiHRg.text: Pho Real lives up to its name because it is good PHO REAL. I had the Ph c Bit or the "Special Ph" which had everything in it. The pho menu is interesting because you have different bowl sizes you can choose from, thin or thick noodles, and the choice to have extra meat or neat on the side. It's truly convenient. The broth itself is not quite right to my taste but it still blended with the rest of the bowl so I'm satisfied. The atmosphere is very casual yet hipster. I don't understand why you would combine a bar and a pho restaurant, but I guess it's a try. I didn't like how the restaurant is on the second floor which is an inconvenience. The service is really nice; the waiters were friendly. The only thing is the high tip so beware. I would come back again to try their other specials when I get the chance to return to Charlotte.

5uwh1huHNkPfKiqXfY5Scw.text: Update: I'm so excited that they have expanded their menu to fit the Keto lifestyle.  You can now sub zuchinni noodles for rice noodles, and cauliflower rice for rice. Thank you so much! It tasted amazing even with the substitutes.

sCQwmDAmyHQ1F8H3IgMZYA.text: Best wait staff, very attentive and efficient. Wonderful food.

LvEOxLShyIoF8sG_j81BkA.text: Love coming here for my lunch boxes . The food is always fresh and so yummy . I get the broken rice box with chicken and the  fried spring roll.  It's a pretty seamless transaction and I'm usually In and out within 3 mins when I order ahead .  I love eating the little cucumbers and tomato garnish after .. Kinda like a  refreshing little palate cleanser lol . Anywho give them a try for lunch if you're in the area .

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Real Vietnamese Restaurant and Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Broken rice lunch box -chicken and fried spring roll

8osN3wXwiweg8hwya3869A.text: I love the atmosphere and coziness of this place. The food is really good and I love the price. The only negative is the ratio of broth to noodles. I feel the bigger the bowl, the more broth and the less noodles.

lNH7Ds4EP1GQub9z5il5LA.text: My first experience almost made me not want to come back. Serious. But my man liked it and so back we came and then they won me over.   My first experience here I thought the pho was lacking flavor and the spring rolls were just okay. I don't order the spring rolls much but I have become a fan.  The papaya salad at this location is amazing. I crave this salad. It is light, refreshing, crispy and fresh. The papaya salad is covered with thin shreds of dried beef that offer some meatiness and has this bright soy dressing that is the perfect balance of all flavors. I normally prefer my papaya salad Thai or Laos style but Pho Real has converted me. I love this papaya salad and will have to get some now that I am thinking about it.  The bun bo hue is good here. Good solid flavor and not oily. I was expecting a piece of pork trotter so I was surprised to see it just pieces of pork trotter in it. I would like more of that. One of the favorite parts of bun bo hue is the pig foot and gelatinous skin and meat on it. The noodles were perfect, the meat was tender and really it was on point.  The pho the last few times has been better and definitely on point. One of the things I always look for in pho is the coloring of the meat. I have seen pho where the rare meat once it gets cooked gets a tinge of metallic coloring to it and I haven't seen that here. Which means their sh&t is fresh. Can't be mad at that. Their soups come in different sizes which is awesome sauce to me. Perfect sizes for everyone in our family.  Get a shake here with the popping bubbles. We were very excited to find this because after moving from Las Vegas, where popping bubbles are available everywhere we hadn't seen it so much in Charlotte. They also offer different flavors for the popping bubbles.   Overall, I really like this place. They have good solid eats.

Hm26e9gAATY74NH8umjJKA.text: Delicious Pho & bubble tea. Also my server Terry was on point. He was very attentive. Will definitely be back.

TsQS9Gex6ap3S6XKNEHyxA.text: I had really been craving some Pho so my husband took me here. The menu was pretty extensive. I chose the vegetable pho with tofu and I was not disappointed. The portion was extremely large and I only got the regular. My husband got the combination and I did not care for it.... it had tendon in it and I just didn't like that. The service was great and the staff were extremely helpful and kind. I would come back again when I am craving some good Pho close to home.

LGC-DhiBdpFnUKyYakjKGA.text: Great food, friendly staff. I'm here for pho tai and spring rolls at least once a week. Better Pho than I can get from around my place so I go a few exits on I-85 to get there.  The only reason I give 4 out of 5 is their to-go ordering. Check it before you leave with it and be careful ordering through Chow Now. I've gotten home one order short on a double order of Pho and Spring rolls, had to wait for things forgotten or had my internet order received 5 minutes after I had arrived to pick up.  Very accommodating, great place. Be careful on your take out.

regZBSr4pLm3nrx3BDfPCw.text: We always come here to eat on lazy Sundays. Servers are always attentive and polite. Pho is always yummy as usual.  Went here today for lunch and tried their hot pot, 'Lau' or whatever it's called (sorry). It was pretty good and filling for two. Mmmm

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Real Vietnamese Restaurant and Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

FsumzBKPHMSKaQ1nm4yWKQ.text: Food was so yummy! I had the Royal Fried Rice without shrimp and my husband got the Pho! Everyone here is so friendly and it's not super loud!

5G7R4DkSffDzxBSwJlXKAA.text: I've been to Pho Real a couple times and it's been the only place that I've eaten pho so, hopefully, this year I'll be able to expand my experience from just one place. However, judging by my four star rating for Pho Real, I'm obviously OK with it.  Pho Real is located at the top floor of the shopping center located off of Harris Blvd that has Total Wine and Ashley Furniture. It's not a big restaurant by any means but I like the cozy feel. There is a long bar area in the back where you can pull up a seat or place your to-go order.  Every time I've visited Pho Real, the service has always been super friendly and accommodating. The waitstaff is willing to explain any menu items and make any needed dietary adjustments.   For my experience, I've had the chicken, veggie (tofu), and beef pho. There are about four different sizes of pho bowls that you can order. I always order the 'little' size and it's more than enough for me. However, they will bring you out a bowl big enough if you have a killer hankerin' for pho. The broth is delicious. Not overpowering but definitely very soothing. They bring out a plethora of pho 'fixins' so you can make your bowl your own.   If on a cold day (or any day, really) you find yourself in the mood for something a little bit different than your typical bowl of soup, make a stop at Pho Real!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Real Vietnamese Restaurant and Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. little size of chicken pho (to-go)

2gasSiX1IMFH8BqMdvvSCQ.text: I bought Pho from here ... to go. I must say, I wasn't impressed. I am always thrown off when my pho comes completely separated, in a bunch of bags and containers.. but even after I put it all together, I still didn't love it. The flavor just wasn't there. :(

rtm566oJ4d6FMQOp2k2dCg.text: I really love Pho Real. The Pho Tai is super tasty, the Pork rolls ate amazing, and their peanut sauce that they serve with them is super yummy! The broth taste great and it comes out quick! The wait staff is friendly and make sure you are taken care of. I really like that they offer different sizes, since you are not always hungry for a large bowl of Pho.

oDL3-IwguvnqepgWXn9thA.text: First time here; the combination stir fried egg noodle and garden pho were both excellent!

2lCGeO4e87BPiw6K_W5RuA.text: Vietnamese food is...... Unlike anything I've ever had. Is that bad or good? Neither. Just different. Visited Pho Real for the first time for dinner with a friend. The waiter was very patient with us, knowing nothing about the food. I ordered the bird's nest. It was noodles that were hard shaped into a bird's nest. On top of the noodles are different meats, vegetables, and a slimyish gravy. You need the gravy to make the noodles soft. As far as taste, it wasn't strong and was similar to what you might have in a light Chinese dish. The texture of the gravy threw me for a loop. Nothing remarkable, good or bad. The spring rolls are different as they are wrapped in rice paper, not fried and are very fresh. While they may not look appetizing, it's like a mini salad rolled up in an easily edible format. I'll be back one day to try other things on the menu.

Photo of Pho Real Vietnamese Restaurant and Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spring roll

uftJHPQSTPTJRLd2hOF11g.text: Prior to the reviews, I was heading to lunch and give Pho Real a try for the first time. Great Vietnamese place around the area.Their sign is a little difficult to see as you're trying to find the place. The restaurant is located at the second floor of the shopping center. Clean and super cozy atmosphere.  The restaurant has the bar area that you can sit and relax with your drinks. We were seated immediately and drinks were served after waiting any "waiters" for 15 minutes. They have a lof of menu selections and portion size that we can choose. Plus, beer and smoothies menu is separated from their food menu. We ordered veggie pho and vermicelli. They came with good portions. The soup was very well done and nicely presented. Very fresh ingredients hands down.  Service was meh, slow and inattentive. Prices were reasonable. A good choice if you are staying in the area. Definitely would return again!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Real Vietnamese Restaurant and Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Combination Hu tien

ontPqt-Ed7f2scyOfJ_67g.text: The first time I had pho it was here at Pho Real. I love the name and the dish is incredible. My friends who grew up eating pho at home say this is as good as it gets. Very nice casual inside. It's nearby UNC Charlotte and definitely draws a college crowd. The staff has always been attentive and quick, which I appreciate. Looking forward to the next time I get to go!

BsUb2PGZhx0YXsnkNJpOKQ.text: Awesome food and great location. The service can be quite slow at times, but the staff is always very friendly. If you're ever in the mood for pho, I would recommend giving this place a try. Just not during a time you don't have a solid two hours for a meal.

7tUu9oWZBcU0uBVc11s0GQ.text: Been eating here 2-4 times a month for 2 years. Used to be our favorite place. Service is always attentive but the last few times hasn't been as good as normal, fresh rolls were excellent but our pho broth (both the beef and chicken based) was not as flavorful and the meal was kinda flat. Also noticed on last trip sanitation score was 90.....not acceptable. Have been branching out to other pho places in the city, hope they get back to where they were before.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Real Vietnamese Restaurant and Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tofu &amp; Mixed Veg Pho (chicken broth base) with Fresh Spring Rolls

fTRIQ3lkow-TVD0KgKlJig.text: The appetizers are great!  I had the lotus salad and tofu spring rolls.  My main dish was okay as it was a typical noodle and veggie dish.  The service was not the best as it took a while to pay & leave, but maybe it was a busy day for them.  I will probably be back as I am close to the area.

IW-aJ2Y7xxJQQiY190xtyA.text: It comes as no surprise to friends that I love pho. The name of this place is enough to entice me to at least check it out, plus it was 10 o'clock at night, some friends and I just have the munchies but don't want any fast food. The fact they have a full alcohol bar is cool and all (not too much of a drinker myself), but because they have a bar they tend to keep their hours late, which is a good thing for me!  The food is decent, have visited 30+ Vietnamese cuisine locations myself, I would not rank this as the best I have eaten, but it is certainly not one of those little shop that you would only visit once and no more.  I tend to rate a Vietnamese cuisine place by three things: the freshness of their spring rolls (not the fried kind), the taste of the broth from the pho, and the signature rice dish. The spring rolls here are okay, I wish they had put more filling into them. The pho broth was pretty clear, I did taste some artificial flavoring, and for the price and the bowl they brought the noodle out I was hoping I would have gotten a bit more. The grilled meat (Chicken and pork) with the rice dish were juicy, definitely not overcooked and dried.  Overall I would this a 4 star because I think for the price I was paying I expect a little bit more.  P.S. Recently they started to advertise "Popping Boba" with Boba tea... very interesting, you have to try to find out why it's "popping"

CEyXBSgXF5MZcpO9HJpcJA.text: This place gets me solid 3 star because the dishes are consistent and very good average. Nothing spectacular but no surprises. Priced at market rates. Great location and friendly staff as well. Luck is on their side with an absence of direct competitors in the immediate area.

N-VcP8hd_LCOpARaYOESSA.text: the most frequently restaurant that I go to since living here. love their diverse choices abt combination, size, noodles and so on. most of the waiters are friendly and helpful, cheap and yummy food

cSuQV8PDC2IdfaPyz3Kcyg.text: I really liked this place! My first time having anything Pho related here in Charlotte, but it was all very tasty. The food was good, and the Thai Iced Boba tea was delicious! We'll definitely be coming back.

bkgH_uoRzEL72yFU62a0Vw.text: i came here with my wife and my son and daughter so total 4 people.. they automatic add tips in my bill....while we ate there the services was terrible...i will never come back here.

bpICNb7WBDCLJTcjwZ_eXg.text: Four of us went to Pho Real on a Sunday evening.  During our time there the restaurant filled almost to capacity -- a good sign of a happy returning customer base.  Our daughter and son-in-law had been there before and were eager to order the Papaya Salad, a plate of thin under-ripe papaya sticks topped with a chili oil sauce and some cilantro.  It was good, but not great.  My wife had a grilled shirmp and pasta plate that would have been much better if the pasta hadn't been cold.  (The shrimp, however, were great)  I had a bowl of fried rice with tofu which was quite good but not outstanding.   S-i-L had a lemongrass tofu dish that was very good.  The atmosphere in  Pho Real was nice, with the exception of a large TV over the bar at the far end of the restaurant.  The service was excellent.  On the strength of our daughter and S-i-L's recommendation, I'd be willing to try Pho Real again in the future.  (If not for their recommendation, I'm not sure we would.)

mjGOrmLgvkfZ3B6kHSpQ0w.text: I'm quite disappointed. Reading the other reviews made me curious to try this place out but it is nothing compared to pho in Maryland. My bowl didn't have much noodles and the soup itself barely stayed hot for long. I wouldn't suggest this place for those who have actually had authentic pho before.

ZDFRqianqwlPEajvjf-JBg.text: First time here.  Good selection and will definitely return soon with the family.

2pzojjx9xrdSYit39ljWHw.text: Francesca from Charlotte....you and your friend sound like complete and utter SNOBS.  I have been to Pho Real a million times, and the service has ALWAYS been above par.  If you're not ready to order....DUH....just say so and be done with it.  Most people that go in there KNOW what they want so perhaps thats what the waiter was going by.  If I were that waiter quite frankly...I'd wish you never came back either.  FOOD SNOBS.  BRAVO TO PHO FOR ALWAYS GIVING ABOVE AN BEYOND FANTASTIC SERVICE, SUPER GOOD FOOD, AND DETAILED EXPLANATIONS OF FOODS WE WERE NOT SURE OF.   YOU HAVE YOUR FOLLOWING.

YZqWX9ONeQlGdJ51NSteaA.text: Delicious food everytime I have gone! The "most popular pho" bowl has met my expectations. Lots of fresh herbs and bean sprouts to accompany the savory bowl full of noodles, meats, and broth.  The broken rice plate with grilled pork, grilled shrimp, and eggroll along with the hot not-ramen-tasting-but-real chicken broth and vegetable soup are always deliciously seasoned and have been cooked and brought out hot and fresh. Great service and beautiful atmosphere!! Highly recommend!

HxkNqIQ1RMtNzb6eBDUShQ.text: Several years back, I was so excited when I first heard about a Vietnamese restaurant by the name of Pho Real!. (There's a What The Pho? In Atlanta!) I honestly don't know why it took me this long to review this place. Living in Atlanta, the asian culture is pretty huge so there's always an asian restaurant everywhere you look. That said, there's not many decent ones in Charlotte. I can't say that Pho Real! is authentic but they're not bad. Their pho is ok. I still prefer my mom's. The rice dishes are pretty good. But I mean, it is pretty typical for any Vietnamese restaurant to serve these rice plates. Tastes the same as the others. I've really enjoyed their Hu Tieu. Really really good! Pho Real is a bit overpriced for what you get & especially it being Vietnamese cuisine. But then again, this is Charlotte, so there aren't many options. Pho Real is clean, which is a huge plus. Service is very polite and attentive. Unfortunately, I couldn't give Pho Real any more than 3 stars..maybe because I've dined at one too many Vietnamese restaurants. So 3 stars is only fair.

zgre7pR5VmQwTS2OdGJtGQ.text: Love Pho Real!! Not the best pho I've had but pretty good nonetheless. Service is always great and pretty fast. My only wish is that they give more veggies with the pho!

Pt7EN123gdArHJOI6P5MOA.text: When I moved to Charlotte a couple years ago, I will admit the name drew me in as something fun.  But the food is what has kept me coming back.  The food is so fresh and delicious.  As a vegetarian, Vietnamese food is something that I rarely get to enjoy because most do not do veggie versions of the food.  But Pho Real does and they do it fantastically.  The fresh spring rolls are perfect with a great texture and flavor.  The peanut dipping sauce is awesome.  I get the veggie pho soup.  The veggies are perfectly tender. The tofu is prepared perfectly.  My husband gets the veggie fried rice most often and it is equally as satisfying.  Our meat eating friends rave about the meat versions as well.  It is a great place to bring diverse tastes.  I go there weekly and bring out of town guests as well .

lJIVTOE2M5mHkd6F-vGVSg.text: This place was recommended by a friend and I decided to check it out because he raves about how great it was. It's a great looking restaurant that's located upstairs. It's not a typical looking vietnamese restaurant, there's a modern twist to the interior design which I give a thumbs up. I also like how they have a bar but food wise, not that great. I should of known since my friend is white, no racism here. It's just I'm vietnamese and I know how pho is suppose to be. I order the beef noodle soup and my friend had the curry soup. First of all, the servers were friendly but holy crap are they slow. Service in general was just SLOW. My table and the table with 2 people next to us were the only people there and it took FOREVER to bring out our food. My pho was just a no go. I took 2 bites of it and I was fed up with it. The broth is not suppose to be dark to the point where I can't see the noodles and toppings sitting in it. That's a sign of the broth sitting the pot for too long or just old broth. The toppings are finely cut prices of beef which they are certainly stingy on. The bowl was big but it was just filled with a ton of noodles to hide the fact that they don't have to give a lot of beef toppings. For a bowl of pho that's around $8, I expected it to be better. My friend had the curry soup and it was decent, bread comes along with it but it might as well not have. The bread was stale and hard as a rock!! This place is just a no go for me.

wpYi9ytsGK6fgGCa7mzjJg.text: This was my first experience with Vietnamese food so in comparison to other places here in charlotte, I can't say it's the best, but this is definitely a new favorite spot for me!! My first thought when looking at the menu was "It better be worth it!!" The food was a bit pricey, in my opinion, but after sinking my teeth into it, it's well worth the $15 I paid.  I was too chicken to be adventurous with in my selection so I kept it simple...I ordered the Fresh Spring Rolls with shrimp (2 rolls with each order) and their Shrimp Fried Rice (sizable portion for 1 person). The spring rolls were super fresh and the sauce you dip them in was amazing!  The fried rice literally was the most flavorful fried rice I've ever had in my life!!!  Service was good and the staff is very friendly and very helpful. Overall I was very satisfied and will definitely be back soon. Next time I plan to try the Pho and TWO orders of Spring Rolls!

tFOJjwwg7gIatHDroJU9fg.text: I don't like this place! I only go here when my friends pick this place for a quick lunch get together. Food is just okay, not that great. Service is usually horrible and it sucks when you go w/ a party of more then 6 because they automatically add a 18% gratitude on your bill and that's probably the reason why they give such horrible service while you're there. The service is definitely disappointing. I had pho here and they told me they were out of bean sprouts. The waiter brought me shredded cabbage as a substitute. I also purchase bubble tea here and they told me they had no bubble left. My bubble tea tasted like a milk shake! If you want good quality Vietnamese food go to Saigon Palace! You will not regret it.  Overall, I would only go here because its clean and in a good area and maybe because it was close by. But definitely would not go here if I had a choice!

Zoh9ajxYriXNAU9J-UVTfw.text: Best pho in nc. Hands down. Better than pho hoa, pho 9n9 in Raleigh, lime & basil in chapel hill, and even the pho places in Richmond,va

I3hjmedCNtZs2aDSt4qz7w.text: Though it is the only Vietnamese restaurant in the University City area do not  let that dissuade that it is indeed very good. I find I'm in the mood for pho mostly when the weather is cold or grey but their offerings are just as satisfying in any weather.  They offer a number of dishes in addition to a couple styles of pho including a spicy chicken lemongrass I enjoyed today. There is no shortage of vegetarian offerings. On the other hand if  you do want that most delicious of soups with an authentic experience beef tendon is an available addition of flavoring (along with all the lime wedges, cilantro and mung beans you care to toss in). Service is fast and attentive.

tTJLuqlnYNfMNSs70eoeRQ.text: I had the beef pho and spring rolls.  I enjoyed both, it was the best pho I have had.  The next time I visit I have to try the different pho combinations.  The staff was also friendly and helpful.

dNGDZITlYmgSEoORYMVJLA.text: I never wanted to be one of those people that give bad reviews but I just had to.  Maybe it's because I grew up in California and have had better pho's, but this place was no pho. I don't know if I came at a bad day or somebody was new but food was bad. No good service can compensate for the food. That's how horrible it was. Don't get the rice plates! Stick with the pho. I didn't try their appetizers but maybe that would be better.

kqpXGD4G38bE8AyLMG9MDQ.text: Great service most of the time. Super fresh ingredients that wont weigh you down even with a large dish. I am an addict for the combination pho bowl. The quail app and shakes always make my day. A great place to warm up during cold weather and a really nice deal for such quality dishes.

GHaxjzf6KuOeLZIYTO7U7A.text: Very good.  I've been searching for a go-to pho place since moving here last year.  The Phoenix Dac  Biet was tastey. The spring rolls and peanut sauce was great too.

ZvHz7dh8_weVLXDyPj5_VA.text: The most disgusting pho ive ever had. I left over half my bowl and all of my broth. I would not recommend this to anyone. I seriously cant stress enough how bad it was and unlike any of the other pho i have ever had.

LaPPIXlRdMwGJTgDB7dkJw.text: I love this place!. I like that I can pick the size's of my soup and what I can add extra meats into it. My favorite soup from there is bun bo hue with extra meats. SUPER DELICIOUS!! And the crispy egg rolls.

oY7fKUEBpSwHfEWPh7uTzg.text: I was in Charlotte for 7 months and I believe I ate here more than 50 times! I love Pho, and they definitely have the best Pho that I've ever tasted! Not to mention the large bowl is $8 and some change. Their fresh Spring Rolls are also very good and always fresh. I never tried anything else from there besides rice, but from what I've seen everything looks great.   The employees are very nice, despite what I read before going there. The reviews actually almost kept me from going there but I'm glad I decided to try it out myself. I think you all should at least give it a try! I've never been disappointed!

Y77liau5B2KTZ7IjXKnTbg.text: The boba here is really good.  They have a pretty  good flavor  selection.  The ambiance  is nice.  I love the art on the walls.  The menu looks great.  I only tried the bubble tea.  Next time I will definitely  have dinner there.  If you do get the pineapple bubble tea ask for a little  more flavor, it was a little light in flavor.  Other than that it was a go.

4EDMluUMVJTErFRwFch29g.text: Delicious!!! Excellent customer service!! We are from California where there is a plethora of Vietnamese restaurants to choose from so competition is steep...Pho Real held up to those high standards and is my new favorite Vietnamese restaurant! Good vegetarian selection as well!

hbQJdTi3G6wq3xwyXZj7iQ.text: Best Pho place I've ever been to! I want to support them so much that I bought their shirt to wear back home! We come here every time we're in town! Keep up the amazing work!

ZQSoI_H0yQU_w4cHNWhzqg.text: LOVED this place. We stopped by here TWICE in one weekend when we were at a conference nearby. The staff is super nice, the service is great but the FOOD was delicious. I'm not exactly easy to please with restaurants, but the food here was superb. I had the Lemon Grass Chili tofu from the vegetarian section plus Jasmine tea. My hubby had a pork noodle dish and our friend some kind of big salad and they were all delicious. It's so nice to find a place that you can get excited about. THANK YOU Pho Real! Yes they are for real ;)!

xCAGF7EPxAtIvN2s75ctnQ.text: The ambiance is good here: clean, modern, and casual.  The service matched it: casual and friendly, if not super attentive.  We ordered two dishes and a glass of wine.  The rare beef pho, the dish we were planning to order when we went for Vietnamese food, was very disappointing.  It was spicier than normal but at the same time lacking in flavor.  The jalapenos were somehow abnormally hot.   We also ordered stir-fried egg noodles.  This dish was much better.  Everything was cooked just right, and although the dish lacked a ton of flavor, it was still quite good.  They have drink specials for each day of the week.  We ordered one $3 glass of wine, which was actually pretty good, and all of the daily drink specials looked pretty good.  In fact, the whole menu does offer pretty good value.    The location is convenient, and the menu has some interesting options, so it may be worth returning to try other dishes, but we cannot recommend Pho Real for real good pho.

p8HBw-H_Ced2cT55cyDqyQ.text: I got a hankering for something new last night, and since I'm a fan of the sushi at Yoshi's I spotted Pho Real across the way and decided to give them a try.  Walked in at 9:30, and was asked if I was ready to order not only once in the first 60 seconds, but twice. Once immediately upon being seated -- so incredibly rude -- and once 30 seconds later after the jackass server brought me and my boyfriend our waters. We were both so offended, I ordered something in haste and he refused to even order, though we were both STARVING. We were so upset that as soon as I got my food I asked for a to-go container. It wasn't that great, honestly. For the price the food is totally sub-par, and it's not even that expensive. Just not worth it.   Terrible service, blah food. Pass on this one. I heard Lang Van is much better, and maybe they won't rush you out the door as soon as you sit down. I will absolutely not be back, not even to give them a second chance.

lxNOOf5kOxsk7kYbuBNmzw.text: I came here on Labor Day and was not to satisfied by the seating layout. This place is not for those of us who are brave enough to eat a party of 1.  Nonetheless, I stood there stomach growling over mindless paranoia. I sat at the only place single guy can eat witch is by the bar.  I got my undesired, though obligated Mich Ultra and ordered some Pho with beef fat and fishballs. Very delicious I shall say.  This in combination with fresh spring rolls. was awesome.  The staff was polite though full of gossip and liked to discuss their schedule alot.  Overall its a cool place to be enjoyed by all

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Real Vietnamese Restaurant and Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Monkey Paws make a great dessert

yO2_7SdYUUA9f_blDIRSdA.text: The food was good, although there was a waiter there that was very rude to my cousin and I. He came out with our appetizers and as he was setting them down on the table I noticed one of the orders was wrong. I simply told him that we ordered the egg rolls, not the spring rolls. He didn't say anything and looked very angry. As he turned around to leave I APOLOGIZED TO HIM even though it was his mistake.  He did come back to check on us throughout the meal which was good but once he came while we were chewing our food and he looked irritated because we couldn't answer him even though I gave him a thumbs up, letting him know we were fine. He walked away throwing one of his hands in the air, as if we were the most annoying people in the restaurant.  I observed his behavior throughout our meal and he didn't seem to treat any of the other customers this way. I have worked as a server before, I would never be this rude to a customer nor would I treat a server in a disrespectful way. I have never written a Yelp review before this, but it just bothered me so much, Not sure if I want to come back after that experience.

PdQJAFaM-PCcf23YWL77LA.text: My coworker and I stopped by Pho Real once to check it out as a viable lunch option.  We took a look at the prices and decided on a state salary, it wasn't.   Our office later decided to have a holiday luncheon there, so we finally got to experience it.  Compared to other lunch options, other Charlotte Asian restaurants, and other Vietnamese restaurants I'd been to, Pho Real was mediocre.  We expected for the price it would be a lot better, but were glad the office was picking up the tab.    I ordered something spicy and while it definitely was spicy, that's all it was.  There was no other flavor other than the taste of hot burning my mouth.    So, no, I probably wouldn't go back to Pho Real.  Unless someone wants to take me there for another office party and pick up the tab.

XColvfFJG844HEtCITH2Ww.text: Pho Real has a nice decor- it was my first time coming here and I think its located in a great location too! I don't know exactly what size of my bowl but my friend order Pho' for the both of us and it had all the meats (tripe, beef, meatball). Everytime I eat Pho' I normally put sugar in it (I swear its a Laotian thing) but here, I didn't have to! The broth was very tasteful. The waiters were very kind! I ordered Thai Tea as my beverage to go with my meal but they could of at least brough me water as well (I shouldn't need to ask).  Overall, my experiences here was amazing! They should make the lights a bit brighter though. I would recommend other people to come here and I will definitely come here again on my next visit to Charlotte.

dFYadFKyJTaD804odspC6Q.text: Cute waitress, very friendly staff..  Huge serving sizes, and cheap.  Had the vermicelli, grilled pork and egg rolls.  Thai iced tea was good as well.

hdukvUwwKkt_WvbHI1QN6g.text: The pho here is sub par. For the location it's great though if you don't feel like driving all the way to central to get better pho. Wouldn't recommend it for someone who want authentic pho. The broth is too murky and not clean and clear like it's suppose to be. The servings on the plates of food are also a bit small as well.

Fq8Rh_tELXDZzgfhbir_LQ.text: I was in the mood for soup and found myself in the University area. I saw the sign for Pho Real and just HAD to try it out. The name is rad, and I hadn't had Vietnamese in months.  The food was good and authentic (to the best of my knowledge) too. Clean, relaxed atmosphere and friendly staff. They carry sriracha in the condiments section of your table (which is a must for any good Asian food place, in my opinion) and that made me all the happier with my dish.  I will definitely be returning- fo sho.

T2jWAXOlfRyGAYsOrJU4HA.text: Great food,  great service and love the flavorful food! I would highly recommend!!!!  Had the lemon grass chicken and pho along with egg rolls for appetizer...yummy

3-CVzOw-1bwsnMMiOPGH9A.text: Great service and the broth was on point! Quick service and attentive staff! Will be back When in the area on business!

IN3ywisogpiJ-bTE6LaxIQ.text: I love it here! It's one of the best places for pho in Charlotte in my opinion. The prices are totally reasonable and the food is amazing! The service is really great and I've always been able to get in right away. It's one of my favorite places to go!

U0TsZdR4QwaTwSl_qMaSPg.text: Ordered spring rolls and they never showed up, that was ok as I ordered the train size special pho and it was more than enough. The broth was good, and the amount of meat and noodles were acceptable though it looked like the "just right" size had the same amount just less broth.  They were good and steady with people which was an indication that we aren't the only ones that like their food. They could spend a bit of time cleaning though as the door and walls were pretty gross with food and sauce stains.

SN1fftGC0Re0j0GyLfdcXw.text: This was our first time trying Vietnamese food. We really wanted to try the Pho, but asked the waiter for suggestions. He recommended the lemongrass chicken dish and it was really good. We also ordered the large portion of crepes with shrimp and crab. We had NO idea what was in store. The waiter asked if we wanted to get our hands dirty. I've had MANY crepes in my day, and NOT ONCE did I have to get my hands dirty. The crepes required us to wrap them in lettuce leaves with cilantro, bean sprouts, and some other herb, and dip. It was so different and we loved it. It wasn't heavy. I can't wait to return to try something else.

ZHz_k41g_BCqNek-F_BwLg.text: Sorry but this place should be called Pho fake. This is just a mainstream place that came about when Pho became a trend but is not the real deal.

HT_IN7lVvFJTXFvBCdcwuQ.text: Went to this place after my first choice right downstairs Crakin Crawfish was a bust. I travelled all the way from Columbia SC with some friends and family because of the 4 stars I saw on this review. I just wanted to say that someone Monkeyshines me with these stars.   Menu Items  Summer spring rolls - The were ok but a bit dry with the rice paper rehydration step.   Fried Chicken Appetizer - The was off the chain. I would order two because the first one almost made me eat my fingers that were clinging on to the yardbird.  Seafood Pho - This is one of my favorite soups however,  the broth was lacking any flavor. I wish they would have taken time to get this right. WTP = what the Pho  Positive note is that the staff was friendly.  I had my friends whom went with me a text me that they are Hangry because of the didn't have a good experience.   I hope you guys get it right some day.

Photo of Pho Real Vietnamese Restaurant and Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pho Real Vietnamese Restaurant and Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

oWDQ5MUnQlNYKMlr2YVRrw.text: I came here on a Monday night with a hankering for some good Pho. The Yelp reviews were mixed but I decided to give it a go anyway. Wanted to order takeout so I called ahead, 5 times and no one answered. When I got there there were 4 waiters, a bartender and a half full house so it wasn't clear to me why the phone couldn't be answered. Even after I walked in I had to scout out a person to place my order.   While I waited I went down to total wine and took my time perusing the aisles. I picked out a nice wine to complement my dinner and then went back upstairs to retrieve my food. When I arrived, I had to find someone again to give me my order.   The Pho itself was just okay. Not bad just not wonderful. I think it's not a bad choice if you're in the area. But the service fell short. If you want excellent Pho and service. Try Lang Van on Shamrock.

zoDFffvQYWKiSFP5tW-Cvg.text: Food is great, the personality the servers have makes the environment more comfortable. The Bubble tea is to die for ! I recommend the taro, coconut, avocado, or the mango flavors!  Went in and tried the new samosas that they're introducing to their starters! They were phenomenal! Can't wait to come back in!

Yv9V2eLepvmEGjMantHOwg.text: Pho is excellent and comes with different serving sizes. I like the flank steak as the meat choice in my pho. The pho soup after putting in basil and lime is delicious and refreshing (les greasy than pho soup in many other places) at the same time.   Bun Bo Hue is super delicious. Ask them to give you chili oil (it's not on the table you have to ask them for it).   Fried quails is actually great, which is surprising (out of all the Vietnamese restaurants I've been in charlotte area, only Pho Hoa besides Pho Real has matching quality of fried quails!) Very impressed!  I gave 4 stars because the service here was soooo slow. We came in at 6:30 and didn't get to leave until 8:30. And the restaurant wasn't that full the whole time! It's a shame though, because the food is very good here. Just need to bring your patience and maybe a book when you eat here :-).

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Real Vietnamese Restaurant and Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried quails and Egg rolls

shPj9DjpgAt4GPjCqFkwtw.text: Absolutely atrocious experience.  We came in and were seated and our server took our order. We waited about 20 minutes and did not have our order.  My wife asked why our order was taking so long and we were ignored.  People that came in after us were getting their food and we din't even have our appetizer.  I asked one of the servers why our order was taking so long and he said he would check.  After another 5 minutes went by our server came and told us he forgot to put our order in.  It wasn't even busy.  He probably only had 2 or 3 tables he was working on.  Then after all that time he had the nerve to ask if we still wanted him to put our order in.  They didn't offer to make up for the horrible service by giving a discount or gift certificate, etc.  No supervisor, manager or owner came to speak with us and apologize.  At that point we walked out and will never come back again.  If I could give a zero I would.

iyC3fC9ohidwAwl_1cxwYw.text: Pros: The quality of food, price and portions are good.  There are a lot of different options in terms of size of the dish. Its also easy to customize to your taste since there a lot of meat / seafood options as well various different types of broths (beef based, pork based, spicy). The standard pho is always very good. One of the few pho places in Charlotte that has glass noodles and you can always ask for extra noodles. The summer rolls are vegan friendly (if need be) - shrimp, tofu, pork or chicken options available. The quail appetizer is always very good as well. Lots of different boba flavours. I tried the green tea today and it's perfect for a cold rainy day - definitely enough to share between two people. Overall for flavor I give this place a 3.5/5  Cons: I've been going here for about 8 years now. The service has deteriorated quiet a bit over the years. Expect to wait longer than the norm after being seated. It takes a little bit of time for someone to come get your drink order. Also, I don't think they keep track of the order of customers being seated. The last three times I have been there    people who were seated after me had their drink order taken before mine. So while the food is good, don't expect to go here for a quick dinner. Also if you ask for chili oil or any other sauces, don't get frustrated if it takes them a little while to get it to you or if you have to ask multiple times before someone finally fulfills your request. It's just the vibe of the restaurant. Just enjoy yourself, don't rush.  For service I would give them a 2.5/5.   This is not necessarily a con, but it states on Yelp that there is Free WiFi at Pho Real. There isn't. So if you're planning on studying while you're there this isn't the place.

HovCQeoyiydpVXdXbVUigQ.text: Best Vietnamese I've ever had! Great location and great service. Ordered mine to go and they packed it so nothing got nasty on the ride home! I will be back!

HVZRO89NWujf1j2PRu9bNA.text: My first time here and it was great! I was greeted with a smile and since I was getting to go food they pointed me in the right direction to get my food. Also the gentleman who took my order was very patient. I asked him LOTS of questions and he was very personable and gave me all my options. Great experience.

6WkIDS84DpMoGB5ECAGIZw.text: Pho real, the name says all. Good food, good service!! Try and you will never regret!

Sq5A-18KgiVSwBGWbR2U-g.text: The food is decent but the service is by far the worst service I have ever encountered in my life. I have given this place 3-4 chances and the service just gets worse and worse. I, as a server myself, could never imagine treating my customers/tables like they do here.

hTe6J16er_64-cNWjcZzBQ.text: Great little spot for Vietnamese food.  Pleasant atmosphere and very friendly staff.  I will definitely be back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Real Vietnamese Restaurant and Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pho Real Vietnamese Restaurant and Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hmmmm great authentic Vietnamese food!

CFfJalpo_s8WkWBi7lpHxg.text: One of my biggest pet peeves with pho is when the proportion between meat and soup and noodle isn't proportionate. The broth to the pho was actually really good so I'm not complaining at all in that realm.   Waiting wasn't an issue at around noon regardless of all the families that are there.   All in all, it's a pretty decent restaurant and the good thing is they have several different sizes for pho which is super convenient if you're craving it but not wanting a super big bowl.

kSX5qcB3hHFdylh7jE94Gg.text: Would have never known this place was around except for yelp. Had some good food. Couple different dishes and love the spring rolls.

GMiNKvIGyKaB5AlDRCMnNg.text: Not real pho. The broth was bland and really lacking in flavor dimensions. Put everything I had on the table and it was still weak. Should be called Not Really Pho.

7q7sN8IJpI_yD8exrWew1w.text: Bun no hue, co tam, and bun thit nuong was all basic. Vietnamese coffee was water down

15lI04VLPIHLZcO7EjJKZA.text: The food were good but the portion seems to be getting smaller and smaller. We waited about 30 mins for our foods , service is average .

VCs2Aga6NOyy46gvWCQWOg.text: Amazing pho!  It's a mist every time I visit town.  Pho comes in different sizes, and you pick the meats.  Servers are very nice and helpful.  The green papaya salad it's a must.  You won't be disappointed!

Photo of Pho Real Vietnamese Restaurant and Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Green Papaya Salad!!
Photo of Pho Real Vietnamese Restaurant and Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Restaurant area!

tUjJHLU7ywhbO9GXeSAdqw.text: Excellent pho for an causal lunch or night out! The staff are all helpful and friendly. I've only had the chicken pho but it is great!  The location is difficult to find if you aren't familiar with the area. It's near the total wine on Wt Harris on the second floor of the shopping center. Definitely go give it a try

gXwfUCvVpxwx4bKUpy436g.text: The pho is amazing!  The broth was rich and complex.  We tried the beef and the seafood based ones and the beef was my favorite.  We had never been here before and our server gave us great advice on what to try to get a sampling of what they offered.  I'm looking forward to going back!

WGAGeiwk73v6JvUIl-2H7Q.text: I came here on a whim one day because I never tried pho and I wasn't disappointed. After coming here a few more times, I can say that they're very consistent with the pho they serve. Always the same portion with the same amount of meat and noodles every time. The flavor is great and very therapeutic if you are suffering with a cold. The waitstaff is helpful if you have any questions regarding the ingredients in pho and help you formulate a pho bowl to your liking. My favorite meat is probably the meatballs and I like the seafood but wish they were a little more generous in that aspect. All in all, I'm a fan and highly recommend to those who've never tried pho before!

K85nMN0Ca13RI-jpCV7tlA.text: Placed order over phone, got there within time frame. Seen my order sitting on the bar and I stood there waiting for at least 10 minutes while servers walked right past me going in and out of the back. Not sure why any one of them can't ring it but it shouldn't take that long to realize someone is standing up there when they looked at me multiple times. Got home and warmed the soup up, ended up being sub par. Not recommended. Would rather go to Ben Thanh.

HK5vR67R4wZ6hfN5NxGJmw.text: Love their lemongrass bun bo hue here. First time for me with my boyfriend, and I instantly love this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Real Vietnamese Restaurant and Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

-HwfAwf2Kg53z6FfTKPQAg.text: Pho real offers a vegetable based broth for their vegetarian customers! To be fair, it's nothing crazy that I can't make myself but it's nice to not feel left out when a group decides goes out for pho. Also I enjoy the selection of bubble teas

9eEewr_BQiWedKHaBu9Y5A.text: Service is very horrible. They're not even busy, even for a holiday. My drink was made wrong and it took a while for them to bring out the appetizer, followed by a long wait before even getting our food. There was a couple that was already seated and ordered even before we did and they just got their food not too long before we got ours.

zJ3-XWggvIptbpL-SFofvw.text: This place is pho-nomenal :) get it? Seriously, the food here is great. Good pho and hu tieu as well as good options for the less adventurous types and vegetarians, too. They have the best boba tea's, as well! I would give five stars but on busy nights, being understaffed is very common. I hope they hire more staff to handle the volume!

OrKVGRoGS576kNEaKwMmuw.text: First time at this restaurant as a first date with my boyfriend! Great soup and perfect amount of pho! Definitely coming back!

6JXpaVJou1tCHq2SU0X59Q.text: Great food and service whenever we go. Wish their pho was consistent with flavor, the last time we had it there wasn't much flavor. Their bubble teas are great and my husband loves their wings.

TX5zVut3n-tGIZTd5VYyzA.text: The last time I dined in at Pho Real was 5 years ago and I had a very bad experience. Never ate there since, but I wanted a vermicelli bowl and asked friends online to see where I can get the best vermicelli in Charlotte and they recommend Pho Real.   I ordered to-go that time though.  But a few days ago, my little family decided to dine-in during lunch, it was just the same as it was 5 years ago. Pho was bland, the combination soup was really bland and the papaya salad is not the one you would think it is (soy sauce vinaigrette and beef jerky? Yup!) The only good dish was still the vermicelli with grilled pork and egg rolls. Oh, their Thai Tea was bomb too!  I would only go back for their vermicelli. Try it, you'll be in love! The only downside is that, I wish they put the vermicelli in a bowl instead of a plate. It would be easier to mix all ingredients.

_smESke1W-fmG4VXEz-1Ig.text: Great atmosphere.  The pho is declining in quality compared to a year ago.  Service is good.

oS9tqgRsNr9mSJIuEeUXcw.text: I come here 3 or 4 times a month and their pho is one of the better ones in Charlotte. I also like to order their wings because it's cooked very well, and I've also tried their rice dishes which tastes great. I only reason I'm giving them 4 stars is because of their service. Sometimes the servers won't check in on you after they serve your food.

Mko8vxbqvfIkR1k1VXM5gw.text: Yes!  Someone does it right in CLT area. Food was great and good prices.  The atmosphere is great the service was great. A lot of professionals at lunch

8hWOEy_Szi1Md0zhDyrhAQ.text: First time visit.  I liked that they have different sizes for the soups.  I ordered the young small size which was plenty for me with wonton and thin noodles with pork.  I enjoyed it .  For my entree I ordered the lemon grass with tofu I requested the tofu to be steamed vs fried so much better tasting in my opinion.  Portion was large.  leftovers  wonderful.    Service and food was very good.  Will be back again.

Cuq1l-313-IybHlXWPdhEg.text: Food is just alright. My bf and I both got the pho dac biet and it was decent. Service wasn't that good either. We ordered our food and afterwards the waitress never even came back. We had to ask someone cleaning up the tables next to us for help.

5RaBFNpbXzAFkwZMH3IK6Q.text: Pretty darn good Vietnamese food. Nice appetizers including fresh rolls and fried rolls. Soup options include beef broth pho and mixed broth hu tieu. Broken rice dishes with pork chops, roast pork, grilled chicken, grilled shrimp.  And now they have added some healthy options which I enjoy and encourage you to try:  Zucchini noodles as alternative to rice or wheat noodles  and  Cauliflower "rice" as alternative to Vietnamese broken rice.

YC5n6LHXdlzBMzLgiYrgMg.text: This place is VERY selfish, they count every piece they put in the soup so  much they would not put ONE more BEAN in it b/c they gave the correct amount. STAY FROM HERE - go to Saigon Bay, they are very nice there and the food is better than Pho Real

x3BHVACZcr-Ew8mPZ2hSlQ.text: This was my first pho experience back a few years ago and it became one of my go to spots. The staff here was friendly and they were quick to bring out food and keep drinks refilled. I always got the pho gha (chicken pho) and I found the broth to be very flavorful. If you want more spice you can add hot sauce to it to bring up the heat.     This place is especially good during the winter when you want a big bowl of something comforting and warm. The restaurant itself feels inviting and cozy and is generally not too crowded. Overall a great place for a bowl of pho!

f5PI1-Ukx5Z6yNnOwfA3nA.text: I am very picky about my Vietnamese, very picky and usually only visit Lang Vang when my craving hits, but a fellow foodie recommended I give Pho Real a try and they have now become one of my go to spots.  I had to ease my way in with them by only ordering one thing at a time to try to see if they would meet expectations and after a few visits I was convinced that they were legit.  All of their spring rolls that I have tried have been just as good as any other place I've been.   I love that they offer several sizes of pho and I always get a small order because I never can finish the larger sizes.  Their vermicelli bowls are really good also and come with 2 meats and all the other goodies, but I sometimes add 3 meats.  I must say I have been pleased with the quality of food here and I'm glad they are near my hood.

LAGVI4pJaJErci6DWzuFfQ.text: Our favorite place to eat Pho! We go once a week just to have the spring rolls with the peanut sauce (the best) and the chicken pho with mixed veggies and tofu is to die for. The atmosphere is very beautiful and the servers are always very nice!

dwO9jfOTXD9h_XlQVagN9Q.text: Always a good selection of food. The place is spacious and staff is helpful. The bar is well stocked and welcoming. My Seafood Stir fry with rice noodles was delicious

08rzH65gy2rNRqCRVQnu0g.text: We went here based off of the Yelp reviews.We were very pleased with the food,service,and pricing.I will return!

4-UGuc7i6bTu9XAh-DQVeg.text: Everyone is always taking about this place so I decided to give it a try. The portion sizing of the train was perfect. The meat quality was great as well.

-L_ua_4iOIo0IIQQAQW59g.text: My favorite pho place in Charlotte! We will comeback again. Very nice staff awesome service too.

S0zWdTSt1GfEmVh5bvQiCw.text: I find the food to be mediocre, I've had better Vietnamese food in Charlotte that tastes a lot more authentic. The pricing here is higher than it should be. The past 4-5 time I've gone here, I've experienced very poor service. The staff is nice, but their service is slow. I've waited nearly 25-30 minutes for my food. I've tried their hot pot and it is flavorful, but the options were limited. I'm not a huge fan of their pho or bun bo hue, but their bun thit nuong and com tam are good.

1XXXMoeIj84WHoCLcK7ZxQ.text: Pho real is a good place to get pho.   1)  The restaurant is clean and there are comfortble chairs.  2)  The service was a little slow. I waited for water for about 10 min.  3)  Spring rolls~ these had a nice crunch to them. the peanut sauce was good. I liked the freshness of the veggies.   4)  Pho Ga~ This was a nice bowl of pho. The chicken was sliced very thinly and the broth had a nice richness. It was however a bit bland and I only had one option was sriracha. I had hoped for a chili paste or house made sauce.

s2sQCh1FpVfNWNR_BjEAJw.text: The best Pho in Charlotte!!!! Love love love this place!!! The price was reasonable and the the amount of food was definitely generous!

lZnXC4e9YYJZ4BIfXTfjvw.text: Food was as good as usual, but this is the first time we've come as a group of six. My sister's food came out as I finished eating with no explanation and they tacked on gratuity.

-xxOGWI0mJsywrFsuLsBkw.text: The best pho ive had in charlotte so far, the food is delicious and for a great price. Appetizers are less than $6 and taste very fresh and well-done. Staff is also very friendly and attentive.

1TTa7QMdduQ_jfS0YzAg0Q.text: They open til 10pm so that's a plus!  Was visiting the area and before the long drive home decided to fit in one more restaurant. Being that it was Labor Day, lots of places were closed... so happy to find this place open.   Came in around 9ish. The place was still very busy so that's a good sign. Got seated within minutes.   Service was great! Girl that helped us was very friendly and helpful. Food took slightly long to come but it was very worth it!   Cha Gio was skinny, but tasted very good. Perfect appetizer size, meaning you can enjoy it and still have room for your meal.   Also got their small bun bo hue. I must say that it is awesome that they give you the option of smaller portions. I felt that the small Bun Bo Hue was the PERFECT size for me. It was delicious, and I would have drank every drop of the broth too if it wasn't for the fact that I'd rather leave room for my Beer Lao.   Cool decor, lots of little details that hints at Vietnam's history/culture but at the same time very modern and trendy music/atmosphere. They have a cool bar too!   Prices are awesome!!!! Very reasonable.   Highly recommended!!!!!

lVakOhWXmSI4sxNKNIAuog.text: Wanted to try a new place in Charlotte that offered great Pho. I'd seen the reviews for PhoReal so I decided to try. The waiter asked abt my drinks and brought them out quickly. I waited about 10 mins for the waiter to get my order, which was the PhoGa (chicken) thin noodles and the just right bowl and shrimp spring rolls. The food was ok. It wasn't as flavorful like Vietnamese Grille. My friend had Pho Nam (beef flanks) thin noodles and crispy egg rolls with shrimp and chicken. We both agreed we like our other spot better.

You can add a plate of thinly shaved beef that cooks in the broth and a plateful of "extras" has mint leaves, jalapenos, lime, and bean sprouts. It's quite the combination.
